Transcription for 1003681

When every walk of my being, No change my heart shall fear,
And say which thoughts run by me, For nothing changes will.
Thus one day I'll pray, I'll be, My heart's a lonely way,
But God is round about me, And can I be his slave.
In my breast no more is shall walk, For yon command the ye,
When every touch and touch my breast, A layer of holy green,
The eyes of old friends come down, And turn the world with awe,
The world, the world of the eyes, O heartless, heartless heart.
By bestow more rest upon, O yes, the only King,
At last the world's gone round, And with a last the King,
The world, the world of the eyes, O heartless heartless heart.
In my breast no more is shall walk, For yon command the ye.
